result.execSummary:
The defendant Brett J Braker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit 2 days if revoked.
Concurrent with: 15CM515, Ct. 2

miscConds.notes: PAY DIRECT TO CLERK OF COURT.  BOND APPLIES.  60 DAYS TO PAY BALANCE.
No contact with Colton Bongard and Brody Bergh; Defendant shall not possess any controlled substances or paraphenalia
Defendant shall be eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
